intro: Bunium cylindraceum var. ellipsoideum, commonly known as the elliptic fennel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, cylindrical stems that are often branched and covered in fine, hairy structures. Its leaves are linear and aromatic, with a strong, spicy scent reminiscent of fennel. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family.
